oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: History of KWTO - Wayne Glenn - part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 3 of a radio segment titled the History Of KWTO, announced by Wayne Glenn, featuring various events, facts, and recorded excerpts relating to radio station KWTO (Springfield, Mo.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Wayne Glenn talks about past performers on the Jubilee -- (00:25) Glenn talks about Don McNeill performing and visiting in the Ozarks -- (00:44) Don McNeill and Jack Baker talk about vacationing in the Ozarks [recording] -- (01:55) Glenn talks about Paul Harvey -- (02:11) Paul Harvey message for Ralph Foster [recording] -- (03:15) [Unidentified] talks about Penny Nichols [recording] -- (03:43) Montana Plains (Penny Nichols) [recording excerpt] -- (04:26) Glenn talks about Buster Fellows -- (04:34) Speedy Halworth introduces George Rose, Joe Morsen, Jimmy Gately, Buster Fellows, and Johnny Tyler -- (04:51) Black Mountain Rag (various) [recording] -- (05:11) Glenn talks about some of the original KWTO DJ's -- (05:26) Comedy routine (Luke McNeilly as Luke Warmwater) -- (06:13) The Old Account Was Settled Long Ago (Lonnie & Thelma Robertson) [recording] -- (07:02) Glenn talks about the variety of content KWTO has been able to provide, and concludes the segment -- (07:43) Love Song Of The Waterfall (Tall Timber Trio) [recording]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: KWTO (Radio station : Springfield, Mo.); Glenn, Wayne; McNeill, Don (Donald Thomas), 1907-1996; Foster, Ralph D.; Nichols, Penny; Halworth, Speedy; Gately, Jimmy; Tyler, Johnny; Robertson, Lonnie, 1908-1981; Robertson, Thelma; Tall Timber Boys (Musical group);
